metadata.title: CVE-2021-46143 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In doProlog in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3, an integeroverflow exists for m_groupSize.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46143` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2
libexpat1 - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

firefox - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.20.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2').
